name: treatment of waste glass from unsorted public collection, sorting | glass cullet, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1875/documentation

A production site with a production amount of 3 times 250 t/d (resulting in 266 kt per year) and a total life span of 50 a is assumed here.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This module includes the efforts for sorting collected glass cullets (energy, materials). No transport efforts are included for the used auxillaries.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: module is based on information from a Swiss and a German sorting site and valuable for European conditions
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology in the middle of the 90's in Germany and Switzerland
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
